Email_in_login.description: Determines whether a mandatory Email field is added to the login screen. Use this parameter to demonstrate that in BPT, a single component can be modified without updating other tests. Default = No. Yes = Add the Email Address field.

ShipEx_repeat_calls.description: Defines the number of times to repeat a call to ShipEx. Use this parameter to find unneccesary multiple calls to the same methods, and affects performance. Default = 0 (no repeat calling).

Add_product_to_incorrect_category.description: Defines whether to move a Headphones item (product-id=13) from the Headphones category to the Speakers category. Use this parameter to demonstrate an error in GUI or API testing. Default = No (category is not changed). Yes = Modify the product category.

DB_call_delay.description: Defines the number of seconds to delay the retrieval of countries during user registration. Default = 0 (no delay). Possible values = Any positive integer.

User_alternate_WSDL.description: Determines whether to modify the field names on the user registration page. (Preferred payment method > Favorite payment; Phone > Mobile phone) Use this parameter to demonstrate API testing. Default = No. Yes = Use the second WSDL request to register a new user

Error_500.description: Determines whether to show an HTTP error code 500 when trying to update the cart. Default = No. Yes = Show error

Sum_added_to_cart.description: Defines a sum to be added to each cart calculation. The sum is updated in to both the Web and Mobile UI (no API). A user must be logged in to enable this change. Default = 0 (no sum added)

Generate_memory_leak.description: Defines the amount of memory leak in megabytes while retrieving the order history. The memory leak is visible in both the UI and the API. Default = 0 (no leak at all). Positive Integer = Number, multiplied by 1000. For example 1 = 1000 megabyte memory leak.

Max_concurrent_users.description: Defines the maximum number of concurrent users allowed. Any additional users are rejected with an error code 500. Default = 0 (no concurrent sessions allowed). Possible values = Any positive integer.

Typos_on_order_payment.description: Determines whether spelling errors appear in the UI. Default = No. Yes = The following spelling errors are shown: - SHIPING DETAILS - Ciity - Recipeint Details (Web only) - ORDERR SUMMARY (Web only)
Typos_on_order_payment.locationInAdvantage: Web: ORDER PAYMENT page ; Mobile: SHIPPING DETAILS page

Misplace_pictures_on_Android.description: Determines whether pictures are placed differently on the home page when viewed on an Android device. Use this parameter to demonstrate how the application may function differently on different mobile OSs. Default = No. Yes = Pictures are placed differently on Android devices.

SLA_add_delay_time.description: Defines the number of seconds to add as a delay in response time when adding an item to cart. Default = 0 (no delay). If you modify this value, also modify the SLA_add_delay_sessions parameter.

SLA_add_delay_sessions.description: Defines a number of concurrent Add to Cart sessions at which a delay is added to the Add to Cart response. Enabled only when SLA_add_delay_in_cart is set to a number greater than 0. Default = 20. Valid values = 0-n. The system starts adding a delay if the number of sessions is greater than the defined value. It will stop the delay if the number of sessions is decreased to less than the defined value. If you modify this value, also modify the SLA_add_delay_time parameter.

Show_slow_pages.description: Determines whether NV report shows problems and errors: HTTP Codes 4xx and 5xx, loading unused libraries, timeout, downloading big images, etc.

Price_diffs_UI_vs_API.description: Creates a difference in the prices shown in the UI and the prices used in the API. Default = No. Yes = Price is doubled in the UI only, for both desktop and mobile, across the entire app.

Allow_Error_in_Login.description: Determines whether an invalid passwords are allowed. These would trigger an error in a test, indicating a security gap in the product. Default = No. Yes = Invalid passwords allowed, such as an empty password, or ‘1’=’1’

Implement_DevOps_Process.description: Enables password changes from mobile, in addition to desktop. Use this parameter to demonstrate the end-to-end DevOps process. Default = No (Password changes are allowed from desktop only). Yes = Add support for password changes from mobile.

Tips_Implement_DevOps_Process.description: Change password is enabled only when the configuration parameter Implement_DevOps_Process is set to Yes. To demonstrate the DevOpps process in a lifecycle management product, do the following: 1. In the Admin UI, set the configuration parameter Implement_DevOps_Process value to Yes. 2. In your product release add a user story to the Change password back end feature (backend only, the UI user stories are implemented already). 3. Demonstrate that you can view this new user story in ALI. 4. Implement the user story by adding pre-defined code from 'feature_1788_DevOps.txt' file located in '\DevOps' folder to the GIT files. You will see a place holder 'TODO DevOps - PlaceHolder Feature 1788' for this code. Demonstrate the DevOps process and that you can now change password on both desktop and mobile.

ShipEx_Free_Number_Of_Products.description: The quantity of products in a single purchase that are entitled to free shipping. Default = 1.

Tips_Mock_SOAP_ShipEx_Service.description: The shipping cost is determined by a table table in the 'shipex-mock-for-db.properties' configuration file, according to country. Shipping costs to countries not defined in the table are determined based on the value for Other. Free shipping can be provided when the number of items ordered is equal to or less than the value of the 'ShipEx_Free_Number_Of_Products' configuration parameter (default = 1).

Tips_Application_Development_Environment.description: The Advantage demo site uses the following software versions and interfaces: - Java server: Java 8 - Application server: Tomcat 8 - Web UI: Angular 1.47 - Admin Application: Standalone .NET - Database: PostgreSQL 9.4 - Schema Management: Liquibase 3.4 - Catalog, Order Services: REST API - User Management: WSDL.

Tips_Scripting.description: The demo app IP addresses are not fixed. In any scripts you create for a demo, make sure to use a parameter for the application IP address.
The demo app IP addresses are not fixed. In any scripts you create for a demo, make sure to use a parameter for the application IP address.

Tips_Fill_User_Location_From_GPS.description: To use your GPS location instead of the default values, toggle on the Use my location option on the following pages: 1. CREATE ACCOUNT, for the user account details. 2. ORDER PAYMENT, for the shipping details.
Tips_Fill_User_Location_From_GPS.locationInAdvantage: Create Account, Order Payment - Shipping details

Tips_Mock_MasterCredit_Generate_Error.description: To generate an error using the MasterCredit card, enter a MasterCredit expiration date earlier than the current day.

Tips_Mock_SafePay_Generate_Error.description: To generate an error using SafePay, enter identical (case sensitive) username and password.

Tips_WebSocket_example.description: To demonstrate WebSocket features, use the chat widget located on the Home page (http://www.advantageonlineshopping.com/), under Contact Us.

Tips_Support_Different_Types_Of_Controls.description: Use the following UI elements to demonstrate various functional testing features: * String: On the CREATE ACCOUNT or ACCOUNT DETAILS page, update the Personal Details fields. * Radio button: On the ORDER PAYMENT page, select a payment method. * Date value: On the ORDER PAYMENT page, select the MasterCredit option and then enter an expiration date. * List box: On the CREATE ACCOUNT page, select a country from the Country drop down list. * Multiple selection: Browse products by category and filter the products shown by using the options on the left

Tips_System_Configuration.description: The Admin UI menu and pages are read-only in the shared system on the cloud. You can make changes in a local instance. Troubleshooting: If you are unable to make changes in a local instance: 1. Navigate to the DemoApp.properties file. 2. Ensure that the Allow user configuration value is set to Yes. This is the default setting. 3. Verify that you can configure the relevant field from the Admin UI as needed.

Tips_replace_3rd_party_services_with_SV.description: Replace the ShipEx, MasterCredit, or SafePay 3rd party services with Service Virtualization by updating the relevant URLs in the services.properties configuration file. This file is located in properties folder of 5 services: accountservice, MasterCredit, order, ROOT, SafePay. For example: /accountservice/properties/services.properties. 1. Navigate to the <service-name>.url.host line, and modify the URL/IP address string to the Service Virtualization URL and IP address. 2. Navigate to the <service-name>.url.port line and modify the port string to the Service Virtualization port. 3. Save the file, and repeat these steps for each service in the services.properties file, and in the services.properties files for each service.

Tips_How_To_Use_Product_Video.description: ADM performance tools support HTML5 video streaming via: native browsers, plugins such as Adobe Flash, or standalone software. To demonstrate this feature, browse to one of the following products and view the demo video: - HP ROAR WIRELESS SPEAKER (Product ID: 22) - BEATS STUDIO 2 OVER-EAR MATTE BLACK HEADPHONES (product ID: 15) - HP ELITEPAD 1000 G2 TABLET (product ID: 16)

Tips_regular_expression.description: The button text always starts with Pay to allow for demonstrating regular expressions in object identification.

Tips_correlation_example.description: To demonstrate correlation, make sure that you include a login step in your flow. The correlation is implemented with the session ID.

Tips_async_example.description: ADM performance tools support asynchronous communication. To demonstrate this feature, browse to any of the products in the HEADPHONES category, and record the comments (web only).

Tips_Swagger_Interface_For_REST_APIs.description: To use Swagger interface for REST APIs change the URL to http://<your-server>:<port>/<service>/api/docs. <service> can be on of the following (case sensitive): catalog, order, MasterCredit or SafePay. For example: http://www.advantageonlineshopping.com:80/catalog/api/docs.

Tips_REST_API_Params_In_Request_URL.description: Send the REST API request and parameters in request URL. Example: http://www.advantageonlineshopping.com/catalog/api/v1/products/1.

Tips_REST_API_Params_In_Request_Body.description: Send the REST API parameters in the request body. Example: http://www.advantageonlineshopping.com/MasterCredit/api/v1/payments/payment, body: { "MCCVVNumber": 666, "MCCardNumber": 6543210987654321, "MCCustomerName": "King David", "MCCustomerPhone": "+12025551969", "MCExpirationDate": "032017", "MCRecevingAmount.Value": 2011.03, "MCRecevingCard.AccountNumber": 112987298763, "MCRecevingCard.Currency": "USD", "MCTransactionDate": "02092016", "MCTransactionType": "PAYMENT" }.

Tips_DFE.description: Send login request and response in Base-64 encoded, instead of in plain text, to show DFE in snapshot (display only).
